question: In the reaction:
<katex>$C_{6}H_{5}CN \xrightarrow[(ii)H_{3}O^{+}]{(i)SnCl_{2}+HCl} X \xrightarrow{con.KOH} Y+Z$</katex>
Formation of X, formation of Y and Z are known by:
explanation: 1. The reduction of nitrile to aldehyde using <katex>$SnCl_2/HCl$</katex> is the Stephen reaction.
2. The reaction of benzaldehyde (X) with conc. KOH to form alcohol and acid salt is the Cannizzaro reaction.
